content: Who directed the classic suspense films "Psycho," "Rear Window," and "Vertigo" during the mid-20th century?

The director behind those iconic suspense films is Alfred Hitchcock. He is often referred to as the "Master of Suspense" and his work has had a profound influence on the film industry. His films are known for their intricate plots, stunning visual imagery, and ability to keep audiences on the edge of their seats.
